intro: Phymatopsis likiangensis, commonly known as the Yunnan phymatopsis, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in late spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
